outputs.output_descr: The Ecosystem Based Adaptation in Mountain Ecosystems Programme, focusing on the mountain regions of Nepal, Uganda and Peru, is a joint initiative of the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), the UN Development Programme (UNDP) and the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN).  This programme has received grant support by Germany's Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety (BMU) for the duration of four years. The purpose of the Programme is to assist countries to manage ecosystems and ecosystem services, with the specific purpose of reducing the vulnerability of societies to the impacts of climate change.

project_descr: Ecosystem Based Adaptation in Mountain Ecosystems in Nepal
project_title: Ecosystem Based Adaptation in Mountain Ecosystems in Nep
